lead_paragraph: GOLBEY--Robert B.,M.D., 93, died peacefully at home on March 12, 2016 with his wife, Monica Hunt, and his son Seth beside him. Born in Brooklyn, NY, in 1922, Bob spent 35 years at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center where he established the Solid Tumor Service and was a pioneer in the development of an effective treatment for testicular cancer. He served in the Korean War and continued in the U.S. Army Reserves, retiring as Brigadier General in 1984. Following his retirement from MSKCC, he and Monica moved to The Landings in Savannah, GA, where he enjoyed playing golf and traveling the world until the age of 90. At his request there will be no funeral service. Bob specifically asked that any remembrances be made in his memory to The Landings Military Relief Fund for Families, or to Hospice Savannah. Please sign our online guest book at www.foxandweeks.com. Fox & Weeks Funeral Directors, Hodgson Chapel. 1/3
